docs.lead_paragraph: It was the first time in weeks Anthoula Papazoi had cooked meat. She had stewed the cut of beef, donated by a friend, on a low flame all morning. But now the casserole sat untouched, as Papazoi fretted about her 13-year-old daughter Nikoleta's tooth.

docs.lead_paragraph: Kentucky Republicans view Tuesday's election results as a mandate to dismantle one of the country's most heralded health care programs in the name of fiscal responsibility.

headline.main: Republicans See Health Care Mandate in Kentucky Elections
headline.print_headline: Republicans See Health Care Mandate in Kentucky Elections

docs.lead_paragraph: The health and financial implications are disturbing for America’s “lost generation.”
docs.abstract: Editorial examines report published by Princeton economists Angus Deaton and Anne Case in Proceedings of National Academy of Sciences that finds white middle-aged men and women are dying at sharply increased rate; notes economists attribute this trend to suicides and drug-related poisonings, which were likely exacerbated by economic downturn; warns of generational consequences if nothing is done to address problem.
docs.snippet: The health and financial implications are disturbing for America’s “lost generation.”

keywords.value: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Now that Matt Bevin, a Republican who has said he is “not beholden to any party per se,” is the governor-elect of Kentucky, members of both parties wonder what sort of leader he will be.

headline.main: Kentucky’s Next Governor, Matt Bevin, Rode In on Outsider Status
headline.print_headline: Kentucky’s Next Governor Rode In on Outsider Status

docs.abstract: Kentucky voters and officials expect Gov-elect Matt Bevin to shake things up in state, in light of his trouncing of Democratic opponent Atty Gen Jack Conway after long-shot campaign; state's Democrats are worried about whether Bevin will work with them at all, while Republicans are wary of fact that he is essentially political outsider.
docs.snippet: Now that Matt Bevin, a Republican who has said he is “not beholden to any party per se,” is the governor-elect of Kentucky, members of both parties wonder what sort of leader he will be.

docs.lead_paragraph: A key government witness testified Wednesday that he warned his former coal company's top executive who questioned the cost of hiring more workers to address safety problems that the company couldn't "afford to have a disaster."

docs.lead_paragraph: Using naloxone, often known by the brand name Narcan, to stop an overdose on heroin or related painkillers called opioids is the first step in a complex process that can include hospitalization, treatment and relapse. Here's a step-by-step look at recovery, based on the accounts of first responders, harm reduction experts and health care providers:
